title: Barcelona news: David Garcia who marked Lionel Messi on his debut says he 'wasn't anything special'
text:
It was 15 years ago this week that Lionel Messi made his debut for Barcelona in the 1-0 win over Espanyol... but the man marking him on that day wasn't impressed with what he saw.

Former Espanyol left-back David Garcia was tasked with job of marking the then 17-year-old Messi during the final stages of the La Liga encounter.

The little Argentine replaced Deco, who scored the game's only goal, in the 82nd minute at the RCDE Stadium and was given less than 10 minutes to make some sort of impact.

And while Messi had such a short time frame to really impress, Garcia insists defending the teenager was a straightforward task.

'We knew who he was, both me and the Espanyol youth players. We knew what Barcelona had in their squad and that he was one to watch,' Garcia told Goal.

'We had seen him in some matches with the B squad and we knew, in part, what he was capable of.

'It was normal [marking Messi that day], he was not what he is now, despite his innate talent. Today he is confident and has grown a lot - nothing like what he was in that game.

The 32-year-old has gone on to arguably become the game's greatest ever player

'I don't remember anything special about marking him, it was like defending against any other player.'

Since that day in October 2004, Messi has gone on to arguably become the game's greatest ever player, scoring an incredible 604 goals in 692 games for the Catalan giants.

Garcia would on to play 200 games for Espanyol before retiring at Girona in 2015.
